definition: to press against/to support/to prop up/to resist/to equal/to balance/to make up for/to mortgage/to arrive at/to clap (one's hands) lightly (expressing delight) (Taiwan pr. [zhi3] for this sense)
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: He laid his hand softly upon the latch , and put his knee against the door .
sentences.chinese: 他把手輕輕地放在門閂上，用漆頭抵住門。

sentences.english: Buck threw himself against his harness, and pulled.
sentences.chinese: 巴克用力抵住挽具，拉着。

sentences.english: Use a water-resistant eyeliner that can withstand tears.
sentences.chinese: 使用可以抵住淚水的防水眼線筆。

sentences.english: Remember, trying something to beat the urge is always better than doing nothing.
sentences.chinese: 記住，做些事情抵住吸菸慾望總比什麼都不做好。

sentences.english: Use that stone there to hold the door open.
sentences.chinese: 用那塊石頭把門抵住，讓門開着。

sentences.english: Lay on your side, on the floor with your buttocks against the wall.
sentences.chinese: 平躺在地板上，使臀部抵住牆壁。

sentences.english: Second, U.S. businesses are poised to withstand contraction.
sentences.chinese: 第二，美國企業可以平穩地抵住緊縮。

definition: to detain/to hold back by force/to buckle/to hook
to press down/to crush down/to restrain (anger)/to keep down (voice)
with all one's might/with sudden force/violently/to slam
to resist/to hold back/to stop/to ward off/to withstand
to close (flower, eyes, suitcase etc)/to bring together/(insect or bird when not flying) to fold (its wings)
to draw (towards)/to be drawn to/to be sucked in
to get out of the way
